transportAdvice: Naxos Town is compact and walkable, but reaching beaches and villages across the island requires a car, scooter, or the local bus network, which connects major settlements and popular beaches on a seasonal schedule. Taxis are available but limited in number, so renting a vehicle is the most practical option for exploring beyond the main town.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally stormy winter weather with the fewest tourists and many businesses closed.
Still cool and wet with unpredictable weather, though days can occasionally be mild and pleasant.
Early spring brings warming temperatures and longer days, though rain showers remain possible.
Mild and increasingly sunny with wildflowers in bloom and a noticeable uptick in visitors.
Warm and largely dry with comfortable conditions ideal for sightseeing and early beach visits.
Hot and sunny with very little rain; the Meltemi wind begins to pick up, offering some relief from the heat.
Peak summer heat with strong Meltemi winds, clear skies, and the island at its busiest.
Equally hot and dry as July with persistent winds and crowded beaches and accommodation.
Warm and still very sunny with calmer winds and slightly fewer crowds than peak summer.
Pleasant autumn temperatures with occasional rain returning and a quieter, more relaxed atmosphere.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as the island winds down for the off-season with many venues closing.
Cool and rainy winter conditions with a quiet island atmosphere and limited tourist infrastructure open.
